message.content:
{"id": "151938", "title": "Bug 151938: Handle duplicate javaagent entries more gracefully", "description": "Failing that, it would be better to fail and give an error message than emit the bytecode. This issue came up for our automated installer, which adds a javaagent flag to VM startup commands. We are making our scripts more intelligent to avoid this issue, but we are probably not the only people who will hit this problem (e.g., if someone manually edits both setclasspath.bat and catalina.bat to add the flag for a Tomcat instance...)",
"OB": "When starting a Java 5 VM with AspectJ's loadtime weaver specified multiple times using the javaagent flag, if there is an aop.xml file defined, it causes issues. Instead of handling the duplicate entries gracefully, the system tries to reweave the already woven AspectJ code and produces excessive amounts of bytecode.",
"EB": "When encountering multiple duplicate entries for AspectJ's loadtime weaver specified using the javaagent flag in a Java 5 VM startup command, the system should handle the duplicates gracefully. If there is an aop.xml file defined, it should only perform weaving on the AspectJ code once, without emitting excessive bytecode.",
"SR": "To resolve this issue, the system should be modified to handle duplicate javaagent entries more gracefully. It should detect the duplicate entries and avoid reweaving the AspectJ code if it has already been woven. Additionally, appropriate error messages should be provided to alert the user about the duplicate entries and prevent the emission of excessive bytecode."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '151938', 'title': 'Bug 151938Handle Duplicate javaagent entries more gracefully', 'description': 'Failing that, it would be better to fail and give an error message than emit the bytecode.This issue came up for our automated installer, which adds a javaagent flag to VM startup commands. We are making our scripts more intelligent to avoid this issue, but we are probably not the only people who will hit this issue (e.g., if someone manually edits both setclasspath.bat and catalina.bat to add the flag for a Tomcat instance...) ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': "If you start a java 5 VM with AspectJ's loadtime weaver specified more than once using the javaagent flag, if there is an aop.xml file defined, it chokes badly: it tries to reweave the woven AspectJ code and emits massive amounts of bytecode. "}
